title: Picks & Bans: Team SoloMid's tremendous team play

replies.body: I'm no fan of TSM, but I respect their precision on and off the Rift. The only thing I found a tad annoying was them giving credit to Santorin for finding Sej when it was Meteos who brought her to the LCS. Down vote if you want, but I wanted to express my opinion. Thank you for a clean article and not bashing other teams on this article, I would like to see more articles on other teams that don't get lots of shine or a article on any team really.
Pretty sure what they meant by that was his personal discovery of his connection to the champion, and not necessarily bringing her into LCS. I could be wrong though
Nah, you are right. I believe that is what they meant to say.

I would like think you for being one of the fews who didn't rage at my comment, I didn't keep up with any other teams except C9 2013 summer through 2014 summer. I was very limited in the teams I watched, and to the Asian scene, and I know Meteos wasn't the very first to play her but I was talking about this split and this season. Don't think this is a comment straight to you, this is for everyone else who has raged at the fact that I don't know all the facts for every single split and every single player and team.
Didn't Diamond brought her to the LCS this split. I may be wrong. I'm pretty sure Eu started it.
I think it was Diamondprox who first played her competitively.
Just say "Fat Man" and "Fat Lady" for {{champion:113}}  and {{champion:79}}  respectively.
Have you even looked at Sej?  She is far from fat.  In fact, shes probably just as slim as any of the other female characters in the game....
Sejuani is a fat man? Kappa

That intro video makes me wanna puke. No, scratch that. ALL these articles make me sick. They're SO FKING biased to LCS, and even more biased towards NA. It's like only NA exists, EU occasionally plays, and Asia only exists 2 times a year when they shit on everyone at international events.

They did one of these for AHQ and Fnatic, before they did this one... They pointed out each team's strengths and highlighted how other teams may plan on countering. The videos are entirely statistics. So butthurt...

Let me count the players of TSM:
-2 Danish players
-1 Korean player
-1 US player
-1 Canadian player
So TSM is:
- 40% EU
- 20% Korean
- 40% NA

That means that TSM is really a team that represents 3 regions and not NA. Glad that a multicultural team won.

lol show me the NA team with 100% native Americans...
... welcome to North America where cultural diversity via immigration is a quintessential attribute 
... not to mention before korea had servers lustboy was playing on NA region before most people knew about this game

Native Americans? You mean the Indians? Yeah, that'd be hard, since there are no teams like that. Also don't confuse immigrants with imported players. None of the LCS players that aren't Americans are immigrants. They are still citizens of their home countries and they're in US working (playing). Anyway C9 is (or at least was until now, no idea who's gonna replace Hai) full NA team.
No, it Native American

TSM needs to make some swaps. Get some brazil and oceana in for the international squad.
Jk, they are probably already the most diverse team and their lineup right now is fantastic.

"they are probably already the most diverse team"

I think only Impulse could challenge them in a game of diversity, swapping the EU element for Chinese.

I remember when I could read these articles and then look down in the comments and find things to laugh at and other people talking about what the article means. Now all I see is a bunch of people bitching about random stuff that they feel they have some reason to be butt hurt about. I don't get why everyone just complains about everything. I'm just stoked that my favorite game in the world also lets me keep up on the professional scene by putting out these informative articles. I literally don't even want to read the comments anymore which is just sad.
{{item:3070}} {{item:3070}}
TSM IS GONNA WIN!
WE BELIEVE! Or at least second
Personally I think they're third best at this tournament, but hopefully they'll have good strategies and prepared well to go far
True.  EDG is better, at least when PawN is playing, and whichever of the top two Korean teams goes is probably better than TSM (especially SKT), but that doesn't mean they can't win.

!**SPOILER ALERT**!












they lose with only 1 win
AHQ!

Seems very weird to credit the NA region for innovative play, when UOL in EU has been the most innovative team BY FAR that we've seen in recent years. They remind me of when Gambit came to the scene with all their crazy picks like kennen ADC.

Overall i don't get why these videos talk about regions instead of the teams that will actually be playing. It doesn't matter if nidalee wins 83% if TSM doesn't even play it for example.  Why not talk about the actual champions the teams picks a lot and have a high winrate on.

If by innovative you mean "cheesing" then yes UOL does that but the most innovative? Nah. NA isn't either but they sure as hell can be credited for some odd picks that are now popular. For example, LemonNation brought out the support Nautilus (but I doubt he solely came up with that), Keane reintroduced the urgot mid pick even though KR beat him by like a day or two, Turtle and Lustboy are possibly the only duo that does Kalista/Kennen (Which is arguably more dangerous than Kalista/Annie). Im sure I have missed some but whatever.

Support Nautilus - EU Fnatic Yellowstar played it first
Kennen support - Definitely did not come from NA

Can you really show any credible examples? I can't be bothered to look everything up. But NA and the west in general have not been known for their innovative strategies and picks. They almost always just trail behind korea/china, and have done so for the last few years.

In my opinion playing champions no one thought were viable AND weren't played first by other regions AND doing good with them. Like shaco jungle, udyr jungle, tf jungle and poppy like UOL did. Is far more innovative. Calling it "cheese" is just a pathetic attempt to talk them down.

Actually, both Yellowstar and LemonNation played support Nautilus the same week.  Granted, the EU LCS happens earlier in the week than the NA LCS,  but it's not like LemonNation saw Yellowstar play Nautilus one day and then the next decided to pull it out.  They both probably practiced it at the same time, so they are equally innovative with that pick.
Keane was the first to play Urgot mid and had been practicing him long before his buffs.
GorillA fron GE Tigers was the first to pull out support kennen not Lustboy IJS.
Edward from gambit played kennen support last season if I remember correctly....
I'm pretty sure that Kalista/Kennen was played in  China first.

Another group may pull it out first but TSM has to be credited with being able to bring out the same pick in about a week. Tsm has shown they can adapt quickly to different picks and that's why they are #1 na
Fnatic got their "lore" told too, don't worry they will make one for every team taking part to the MSI, btw i don't think pro teams need this to know the strength/weaknesses about each other xD
you do know that all teams have their own professional analysts right? pretty sure anything written in a lolesports article would already be common knowledge for opponents.

TSM has a very good chance being that in worlds they were expected to get stomped and lose 0-3 but they ended up beating the undefeated korean team in a 1-3 (sadly they lost but they gave up a good fight) and went on to be the only team to beat them so i really have high hopes for tsm because i wanna see some TSM Skins i mean come on its tsm #TsmMadness at MSI
Royal Club took a game off Samsung White as well

TSM did not put up a good fight against Samsung White at all. White completely trolled in the first three games, and was still able to stomp TSM twice, and after basically throwing game 3 White took it seriously and decimated TSM in game 4. Cloud 9's loss to Samsung Blue was a good fight, but saying  TSM v White was a good fight is like saying SKT v Fnatic at all stars last year (the game where SKT picked all their World Champion Skins to go for style) was a good fight, or saying WE put up a good fight in the IEM finals where TSM murdered them in the last two games.

obviously you did not watch game 4 between TSM/SSW, because TSM was out-rotating SSW all throughout that game. They just got caught that one time when Amazing went too early and TSM got aced. SSW was not the greatest at rotations and TSM took advantage but it just wasn't enough because they couldn't get through the twitch/kayle combo, which at the time was insanely strong when perfected.
For anybody looking for the Lustboy flash into the blitz pull it starts at about 24:10. The author should have youtube linked to the time and not an hour long video...
Awesome, thanks Kenny. Sorry you die all the time lol.
Wasn't Urgot popular in other regions before NA busted it out? Why would they say that NA brought Urgot back lol.
Because Keane was the first to play it and had been practicing it in solo queue long before there were ever buffs.

Someone in Korea played it a few days prior to that Gravity/TSM match. NA is the region that didn't play it as a "cheese" strat, but a pick that showed up with relative frequency.

For example: Hai played Teemo at the beginning of one of the splits in S4. Let's assume that, suddenly, Teemo became hot over in China after that game. Did NA really bring Teemo back (even though it was only one game), or was it China because he would've actually become part of their meta?
Even I'm not a fan of TSM, I have to say as a new guy, Santorin did very great job in the Jungle. Can't wait to see him against Korean.

I think that with Loco's insight in the game and the amazing precision of this team they actually are the key to NA's first worlds victory. Even their support can carry, I remember one game, I forgot against who, but Lustboy single handily won them the game on Annie, and they were losing that game for the most part.
I think it was the first game against WE in the finals.
Hey guys, can we try to keep minor swear words out of the articles? It's not a big deal, but it's distracting and unprofessional. It's also unfortunate that you think it's appropriate.
